title: @Meddler: When can we expect Rek'Sai and Kindred changes?
body: I remember reading that Shyvana-scale reworks were planned for these two champions, and as a jungle main I'm always on the lookout for new things to try. Just wanted to ask for a guestimation on when we might be seeing some stuff on the PBE. Thanks!

replies.body:
Rek'Sai changes are coming along fairly well, so moderately soon? Next of those style of updates almost certainly. At least a few patches away, potentially more depending on how long the art changes take (we're close on gameplay, but until that's locked down art can't start on needed work). 

We don't have changes like that planned for Kindred.

Kindred literally does not have a single match up in the game that's in her favor, they're all out of favor for her. How is that in any way shape or form balanced?

She's also been nerfed across the board significantly in every way to the point Kindred OTPS have to abuse rune and mastery gimmicks just to even be acknowledged. How is that balanced? 

Kindred players have to have countless games on her just to even compete with a basic FOTM jungle player. How is that balanced?

Kindred starts, continues, and finishes behind the enemy jungler regardless of how far ahead she somehow miraculously gets. How is that balanced?

Kindred can single handedly lose a game based off of RNG first mark spawn. How is that balanced?

Kindred can single handedly go an entire game without getting a mark if the camp double raptor procs due to the nature of how jungle clearing + levels work. How is that balanced? 

Her current winrate in NA is being held up by me and like 15 players in diamond and we're all Kindred players with hundreds upon hundreds of games on her. If a champion being balanced is only being playable by an extremely small hand full of players I'd argue that's not balanced. 

Whatever, I guess you better go buff Graves since LCS is coming up. Heaven forbid he's not the strongest champ in the game for yet another season.

The sad thing is literally all they need is some AD/level to replace the lost fervor damage. They're not even in that bad of a state, just pretty obviously underturned and it seems everyone but riot and salty jungle players realize this. Kinda feels like a slap in the face for meddler to say they're balanced and not "yeah they're weak but inherently unhealthy so sorry we keeping them weak".

Semi-curious. Since we've heard of so many in the work, is there any working plans to release these mini-reworks in batches of "big 4" or "big 6" like class updates?

As always, thanks for sharing.

With updates like this we'll be releasing them whenever they're done. We go with bundles for the class updates because there's value in having a lot of people thinking about one class at the same time, including those working on items in conjunction with the kit updates. For one offs though we think it makes more sense to just put them out whenever they're ready.

In terms of number in the works right now it's just Rek'Sai in a significant way. We were looking at Aurelion Sol too, the directions we were interested in testing didn't hit the mark though. We were experimenting with making his orbiting stars a sometimes thing (activate with W for a duration) looking for increased moments of counterplay and satisfaction. When those changes actually went into testing however consensus was it didn't feel better to play against, people who didn't already play Aurelion Sol didn't feel it was better and existing players felt it was worse. We've pulled those changes as a result. Might look at some small scope tweaks instead, nothing major planned anymore though.

Hey Meddler, a while back you said you felt Karma was bland and not sufficiently satisfying. Do you feel that it's worth giving Karma a mini rework to address her issues once and for all? This has gone on for far too long and everything that has been done to Karma up until now seems to fly in the face of Riot's design philosophies.
Only Rek' Sai? I thought Aatrox was getting mini rework too.

We'll almost certainly do an Aatrox update when we do a diver class update. Would like to find some small stuff to improve him in the meantime. We've been testing some stuff though and haven't yet found a set of changes we think would make him healthier and feel like an improvement to Aatrox players.

No offense but you guys have been saying that you would give aatrox some small changes in the meantime before a rework for quite some time now, but nothing has been done and the times you said the changes would be here have come and gone.

what direction would you consider taking him in?

More of a stand alone fighter or a enchanter/front line fighter?

I know for the longest time one of the biggest gripes was how his gameplay didnt reflect his lore at all. Nothing in his kit inspires bloodlust in his allies that lets them turn the tides.

He sort of just plops himself in the middle of the team and gets to swinging. Would you like to keep the "one man army" aspect or try to tune him towards something else?

ok cool, thanks for replying to me.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Fixing his Q would be a good start.

Then nerfing the shit out of Grievous Wounds or buffing his healing. You could even give him healing like Warwick: Doubled under half, tripled under 25%.
Aatrox already gets tripled healing from his W when below half health.
I mean something similar. As in even more healing at 25% or less.

I have a neat idea for a Aatrox buff! You know how Vi, Shen etc. can extend/reposition their abilitys?
Let his Q be able to reposition with flash midflight!
I know its not just a small numbers change, you need to change the actual code to enable that, but this would be a nice idea. He can make plays by getting that Q flash knockup, but it also takes skill to pull that of! All without buffing any numbers, thus potential overbuffing him.
What do you think about this idea?

eww gross.
Why not just give his Q a benefit if he's interrupted. 
When dashing if you're damaged you fall to the ground immediately knocking up whatever's under you. 
Fixed

Wouldnt this punish skill? Most knockups are melee so if you interrupt his dash he would knock you up(or at least do dmg). So you dont want to interrupt it, which is counterintuitiv. Because you should be rewarded if you manage to interrupt it.
My idea would requiere skill from the Aatrox player to make use out of this mechanic successfully. So your own skill will be rewarded. Or did I not understood your idea fully?
There's... there's not much skill cap on aatrox nor is his counterplay difficult. I figure this would be a little be of love towards a struggling champion.

Thats why i said that we could technicaly increase his skill cap and thus viabililty with this flash Q combo.
It is also a straight buff.
I was saying that we don't want another cancer flash interaction.

This "cancer flash interaction" would be a straight buff, without any drawbacks. The only requierment is that you are skilled enough to pull this off.
I may be a bit biased but I cant accept your opinion as better or equal if you dont give me facts.
Mere "i dont like it" is not good enough for me to drop or change my claim.
You can have your own opinion and totally different from mine and that is completely fine, i absolutely have no problem with that.
But when talking about balance and facts opinions become less important, and yes my opinion also does become less important.
Facts are not influenced/changed by opinions.

Let me put the pros and cons down.

Pros:

- No numerical buff, which could potentionally overbuff him
- Skill is requiered and provides/extends the learing curve (raising the skillcap is never a bad idea)
- Provides more outplay potential( if the enemy uses a spell on your target location you can flash and also do dmg, and not only avoiding the spell)
- Aatrox can gain reliable hard CC and technicaly extended range of his Q, but at the costs of his summonerspell
-  This give the Aatrox player the ability to create a mindgame (he could Q towards you and try the flash combo, which you can only avoid by flashing it, or he could use it without his flash to bait your flash)
- not easy pulled off, but also not to hard to learn, and provides a "high risk, high reward" option
- ( looks cool and feels rewarding/fun if you can pull it off, like other combos)

Cons:

- a mechanical buff could make him op, but numerical buffs/nerfs can be used afterwards to balance it out, since they are easier to balance (but this "op state" is highly doubtful)
- requiers a bit of training to pull off successfully
- a bit mechanical skill needed, otherwise you could fail the combo

This is the comparison, if i missed something very important please tell me!
Otherwise this clearly says that giving Aatrox the ability to combo his Q with flash is a good idea.
Considering his current state. 

I am sorry if this sounded like a personal attack, but i can promise you that this what not the intention nor its purpose!
I only stated my point of view and the facts.

Aurelion Sol is supposed to be Battle Mage so what about adding shield so that he has it easier sustaining in battle for damage and shift his ult to be DPS based, too? The ult might be initiator instead of finisher since it already has such potential by shifting enemies to outer rim.

Basically AS deals some smaller damage to enemies, pulls those too far to outer rim and knocks those too close to outer rim and make them radiant. Stars that hit radiant enemies would deal increased damage or heal AS or would slow them or combination of those.

And possibly make it so that if he heits enemy champion with Q he gets some shield. Or that he heals ("spellvamps") from star hits.

I agree those ideas aren't very... appealing. I've just started practicing with Sol, and one of the cool things aobut him is how the passive is always going on. I wouldn't want to see it removed.

However, he gets hard-countered really hard. it would be interesting if Riot could soften up a bit his coutnerplay (but not remove it entirely, of course).
- Have his Q be able to be discharged at melee range, but at half effectiveness.
- Have his passive not be completely disabled on CC, but instead half as effective/ fast.

This way, Sol players would have an actual chance of getting to safety when caught in melee, instead of afking to their inevitable death. At the same time, i don't think they would be too strong.
